title: Population Age Demographics Boxplot
description: The following box plot shows the U.S. population for a certain year.

parts.solution: more children; the left whisker shows that 25% of the population are children 17 and younger. The right whisker shows that 25% of the population are adults 50 and older, so adults 65 and over represent less than 25%.
parts.question: Are there fewer or more children (age 17 and under) than senior citizens (age 65 and over)? How do you know?

choices.value: "more children; the left whisker shows that 35% of the population are children 17 and younger, while the right whisker shows that 15% are senior citizens 65 and older."
"fewer children; the left whisker shows that 20% of the population are children 17 and younger, while the right whisker shows that 30% are senior citizens 65 and older."
"more senior citizens; the left whisker shows that 20% of the population are children 17 and younger, while the right whisker shows that 30% are senior citizens 65 and older."

"more children; the left whisker shows that 25% of the population are children 17 and younger. the right whisker shows that 25% of the population are adults 50 and older, so adults 65 and over represent less than 25%."

parts.question: {{ params. percent_senior }}% are age 65 and over. Approximately what percentage of the population are working age adults (above age 17 to age 65)?

info.label: $p=$
info.code:
total_population = 100
percent_senior = params.percent_senior
percent_working_age_adults = total_population - percent_senior
percent_working_age_adults = percent_working_age_adults - (total_population * 0.05) - (total_population * 0.02)
percent_working_age_adults = round(percent_working_age_adults, 1)
percent_working_age_adults

solutions: more children; the left whisker shows that 25% of the population are children 17 and younger. The right whisker shows that 25% of the population are adults 50 and older, so adults 65 and over represent less than 25%.
